wikipedia_page.main: James Phillip McCarten (born 8 November 1990 in Netherton, Merseyside) is an English semi-professional footballer who plays for City of Liverpool FC.

response: During the 2015–16 season the club set many new club records including scoring over 100 league goals and also winning over 30 league games in one season. Attendances at the club increased with a seasons average of 418 per game, including two crowds of over 1,000 for the games against Northwich Victoria and Prescot Cables. The Club Chairman decided to part company with manager Shaun Reid by mutual consent in February 2016, replacing him with Stuart Mellish and Lee Smith. Mellish and Smith led Town to the league title, finishing 15 points clear and setting division records of 106 points and 121 goals scored, and gaining promotion to Northern Premier League Premier Division. Team captain Ciaran Kilheeney was the top scorer in all 3 NPL divisions with 37 league goals,  and he, James McCarten and goalkeeper Karl Wills were named in the NPL Division One North team of the season.
* Academy Player of the Season - James McCarten

** Academy: Scott Phelan (2006), Shaun Densmore (2007), Jack Rodwell (2008), James McCarten (2009), Adam Davies (2010), Jake Bidwell (2011), Hallam Hope (2012), Chris Long (2013), Ryan Ledson (2014), Harry Charsley (2015)
